column2: RHODE ISLAND DMV TEST
Question Text
1. When driving on roads that may be slippery:
column6: use cruise control to maintain a steady speed.
column8: always drive at the highest speed allowed.
column10: do not make any sudden changes in direction or speed.

column2: 2. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:
column8: drive as they would on dry roads.

column2: 3. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column4: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 4. Who is most at risk?
column8: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.
column10: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.

column2: 5. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: having them checked by a mechanic.
column8: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.

column2: 6. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column6: you are not allowed to park here.
column8: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column10: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 7. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
8. This sign warns drivers of:
9. Drivers may pass on a two-lane roadway marked with a single solid yellow line on their side of the center line.
10. This road sign means:
column10: Do not use your brakes in this area

column2: 11. When driving at night, drivers should:
column8: look directly into the oncoming headlights of approaching vehicles.

column2: 12. There is no crosswalk and a pedestrian is crossing your lane ahead. You should:
column4: make eye contact and then pass the pedestrian.
column6: slow down as you pass the pedestrian.
column8: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.

column2: 13. If the vehicle you are driving starts to skid, you should:
14. With conventional brakes, the correct way to stop in an emergency situation where traction is lost and the car slides is by pumping the brakes.

15. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
16. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: on the left shoulder of the road.
column6: near the right curb or edge of the road.
column8: near the left edge of the road.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
18. When changing lanes, __________ to be sure no one is in the "blind spot".
19. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column8: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
21. If you drive much slower than the posted speed limit you:
column6: always have the right of way.
column8: are driving safely and can avoid tailgaters.

column2: 22. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column6: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.
column8: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column10: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.

column2: 23. If you see an animal on the road:
column6: pass the animal as fast as possible.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
25. Regulatory signs:
column4: regulate the flow of traffic at school zone.
column6: provide information about the road rules and traffic laws.
column10: are diamond shaped and yellow or green.
